Header: MP Dinesh Gunawardena is the New Leader of the House.
Content: Co-Cabinet Spokesman Keheliya Rambukwella says that a unanimous decision was taken to appoint MP Dinesh Gunawardena as the New Leader of the House. Mr. Rambukwella said that the decision was taken during a special discussion of a majority of members at the Prime Minister’s office this morning. Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa has called all the Parliamentarians who support the Government to his office this morning. It was to discuss several decisions. Party Leaders and a majority of Parliamentarians were present at the meeting. The Prime Minister’s Media Secretary said that lengthy discussions took place on future course of action. Mr. Rambukwella said that the government can show a majority in Parliament by now. He said that the parliament will meet ceremonially on the first day and the agenda will be prepared after that. If someone says the Speaker can prepare the agenda and change it later that is against the traditions. He said that only the President can prorogued or convene the parliament. He emphasized that it should be done through a Gazette notification.
